title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.44 | 18-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananj Nishalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Ganadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
In this session we will be discussing from the 44th verse
Of the 7th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
The meaning of this verse is
that you learnt the military art of throwing arrows
and the confidential art of controlling weapons.
So Shri La Prabhupada explains in the purport
Dhanur Veda or military science was taught by Dronacharya
with all its confidential secrets of throwing
This is unknown in modern times.
Gross military science is dependent on material weapons
but finer than that is the art of throwing arrows
which act more effectively than gross material weapons
like machine guns or atom bombs.
The control is by Vedic mantras
or the transcendental science of sound.
The sound can be used to direct a weapon,
To target a particular person when you release a weapon.
n a n a N a n i n a n a n.

A n e n a y n a t a n o n t a n t a n t o n t o n t h a n t o n t o n t o n t e n t o n t t o n t o n t c o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n t o n . I.
it is said that Maharaj Dasaratha,
the father of Lord Sri Rama
used to control arrows by sound only.
He could pierce his target with his arrow
by only hearing the sound without seeing the object.

It is called Shabda Vedi. Just like I cannot see where is a bird, but the bird is chirping. And by Shabda Vedi, I can release an arrow. It will go wherever the bird is by the dint of the sound the bird is making.
And it will go and kill that bird. So, this is called Shabda Vedi. Now Maharaja Dasharatha used it. He knew this science and he used it.
And once he made a mistake of instead of killing an animal in the forest, he killed a
boy, one Brahmachari. It is described in the Ramayana. Because that Brahmachari had come,
he was taking his parents on a pilgrimage and they were old. He was carrying them in a palanquin
and when they were thirsty on the way, so he stopped and he went to fetch water.
So, he went looking for a water source and he found a pond with clear water. So, he tried to take
some water in a pot. So, when he dipped that pot in the pond to get water, it made sound and this
was actually hiding. And when he heard that sound, he thought here is
some animal that has come to drink water in the pond.
So, he released an arrow aimed at whoever was actually making that sound
while fetching water or drinking water. And the arrow went and actually pierced
Brahmachari. His name was Shravan Kumar. That is described in the Ramayana.
And Shravan Kumar almost immediately was killed by the arrow released by Dasharatha.
Then Dasharatha, after having released the arrow, when he heard a human being is crying out,
Oh, I have killed a Brahmachari. He never intended to kill a Brahmachari. No. But he mistook
by the sound of that pot he was trying to fill. He mistook that sound to be
the sound of an animal drinking water. And because he knew the science without seeing the target,
He actually shot the arrow, Shabda Vedi, and it went and pierced that target.
The Brahmachari who made that sound while filling the pot.
So when he came and saw, he was very, very repentant.
Then just before that boy died, he said, my parents are waiting nearby.
They are elderly. They are in a palanquin.
So kindly give them water. They are very thirsty.
So this Dasharatha, and saying this, he died.
Dasharatha took that pot of water and actually went to give that water to nearby.
He saw a palanquin and two elderly people.
Obviously, the parents of that Brahmachari, Shravan Kumar, were sitting.
And tried to give them water.
He said, I am actually a king.
And I had come for hunting.
And I am very sorry to inform you that by mistake, instead of killing an animal, I killed your son.
So I have come to give you water.
They were extremely aggrieved because only his son, they were dependent on him.
And they cursed this Dasharatha that even Dasharatha would die being aggrieved by the loss of his son.
at the time of coronation of Lord Ramachandra, his eldest son,
he was obliged to his youngest queen, Kaikeyi,
that she demanded that Rama be banished, sent to the forest in exile, 14 years.
And that her own son, Bharata, be enthroned as the king.
And because Dasharatha was bound by a promise to this queen, Kaikeyi,
he had to actually fulfill that promise.
And then even though he was reluctant, when Rama came to know that his father had promised his stepmother,
so he agreed to actually fulfill that demand of his stepmother.
Because he wanted to keep his father's promise intact.
He did not want to break that promise.
So Rama was, he went away to the forest.
And Dasharatha could not tolerate that his son was actually banished just when he was about to be coronated.
And in that grief he died.
Of course, because Rama is no ordinary son,
dying while constantly thinking and calling out his name,
Because Rama is the Supreme Lord.
So that was his blessing that he got the Supreme Lord as his son.
And therefore, even if, whatever be the case,
But still, Dasharatha did commit a grave mistake
by not properly utilizing the Shabda Vedi.
And that's how Arjuna was taught all this by Dronacharya.
It is one of the Upavedas.
The science of dance and music.
That's how they used to build beautiful temples.
So all these sciences are there.
Because the main subject matter of the Vedas
Krishna says in the Bhagavad Gita,
subsidiary subject matter of the Vedas.
Because the main aim of the Vedas
the main teaching of the Vedas is
And what is my relationship with Krishna?
This is the ultimate goal of life.
To re-establish our lost relationship with Krishna
merely the use of that particular skill
They won the battle of Kurukshetra.
But they ruled for very short time.
But when they came to know
they handed over charge of ruling to

is to prepare oneself to quit
you remain here on the earth
Because they are all belonging to
they are all belonging to Krishna.
So they go back to Krishna.
They came for the sake of participating
This is the position of a pure devotee.
So as pure devotees they never
forget they teach us by their
They are not carried away by those
